conclusion: To determine when the two objects meet, we need to analyze the velocity-time graphs of Object A and Object B.
Object A's velocity-time graph is shown in the diagram.
Object B's velocity-time graph is also shown in the diagram.
Object A starts with a velocity of \( v_0 \) at \( t_1 \).
Object A's velocity decreases linearly to 0 at \( t_2 \).
Object A then reverses its direction and accelerates back to \( v_0 \) at \( t_3 \).
Object B starts with a velocity of \( v_0 \) at \( t_1 \).
Object B's velocity decreases linearly to 0 at \( t_2 \).
Object B then reverses its direction and accelerates back to \( v_0 \) at \( t_3 \).
The two objects start moving from the same location in the same direction.
The graphs show that Object A and Object B meet at \( t_3 \).
Therefore, the two objects meet at \( t_3 \).
